Argentina: Action of 14 May 1814 saw United Provinces' fleet defeat Spanish navy securing coast
Second Triumvirate replaced by position of Supreme Director, first occupied by Gervasio Antonio de Posadas
Belgium: Belgium made part of the United Kingdom of the Netherlands.
Chile: The "Disaster of Rancagua". Mariano Osorio, in command of a third Spanish expedition, defeats O'Higgins (October 1 – 2). Osorio reconquers Santiago for Spain. Exodus of Chilean patriots to Mendoza, Argentina, where they receive the support of José de San Martín. Those patriots who remain in Chile are captured by the Spaniards are deported to the Juan Fernández Islands. Osorio is confirmed Governor of Chile by the Viceroy Fernando de Abascal of Peru. The talaveras, under the command of San Bruno, install a regime of terror extending to those merely suspected of sympathy for the Chilean cause.
Colombia: Manuel de Bernardo Álvarez del Casal is declared President of Cundinamarca and Vicegerent of the King's Person
José Luis Álvaro Alvino Fernández Madrid, is president of the United Provinces of the New Granada.
France: First Restoration: The House of Bourbon was briefly restored with Louis XVIII as King of France in an intermediate period of the Napoleonic Wars.
Germany: War of the Sixth Coalition: France signed the Treaty of Paris, under which it returned to its 1792 borders and the House of Bourbon was restored to the French throne, ending the war.
Haiti: Christophe refuses to negotiate with French delegate Franco de Medina concerning France's recognition of Haitian independence
India: "Atmiya Sabha" Established by Raja Ram Mohan Roy
Indinesia: Java returned to Dutch rule following the Anglo-Dutch Treaty of 1814.
Malta: Under the Treaty of Paris, and subsequently ratified by the Congress of Vienna, Malta status as a British Crown Colony is confirmed.
The Grand Harbour becomes an important shipping waystation, eventually serving as the headquarters for the Mediterranean Fleet. (to 1930)
Nepal: Anglo-Nepalese War; culminates in treaty which establishes Nepal's current boundaries. (to 1816)
Philippine: Ferdinand VII proclaimed as King of Spain; Conservatives return to the Spanish Cortes
Mt. Mayon erupts, affecting Albay and leaving 1,200 dead.
Sweden: The countries of Sweden and Norway are united.
USA: Burning of Washington: British troops burned Washington, D.C. but were forced back at Baltimore.
War of 1812: The Treaty of Ghent ended the war.
